articles.name: Release notes through 2024-09-13
articles.title: Release notes through 2024-09-13
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released in the last month.

This week's release notes include:

    • AI agents (formerly bots)
    • App Marketplace
    • Products with no updates this week

AI agents (formerly bots)

Fixed

  • Optimised handling high conversation loads to improve data load performance in the Insights dashboard.
  •  

App Marketplace

New
  • Ticket Parser Autofill (Support)
    • Ticket Parser Autofill automatically extracts data from ticket comments and auto-fills fields.  Automatically identify and extract key information such as order numbers, customer names, product details, and more from ticket comments.  Save time and minimize errors by automatically filling extracted data into the relevant ticket fields without manual intervention.  Easily set up and modify parsing rules tailored to your specific needs without needing complex regular expressions.
  • Onoff Business (Support)
    • Onoff Business is an innovative professional mobile communication for companies of all sizes. There is no need for a second device, SIM card, or another mobile contract to provide mobile numbers to your employees.  Automatically create support tickets for calls, voicemails, and SMS messages within your Zendesk Support account.  Quickly access customer information from Zendesk Support directly on your Onoff Business contact page, making communication management seamless and efficient. Export and import contacts between Zendesk Support and Onoff Business, ensuring that your customer data is always up-to-date.
  • SyncHub (Support)
    • SyncHub connects your Zendesk account to Power BI, Tableau, Excel, G-Sheets, or your favorite reporting tool, allowing you to build custom reports or integrate with your existing BI dashboards.  SyncHub works by querying the Zendesk API for changes to your data and then incrementally storing those changes in a reporting database. Choose from 50+ connectors to connect other cloud services you use, then build aggregate reports across your entire business. 
  • Tangle (Support)
    • Tangle makes it easy to keep track of all your customer emails. No matter where they are or what system sent them, Tangle stores them all. No more guessing what an email looks like, where to find it, and how to resend it if a customer asks.  Connect Tangle with Zendesk and quickly view the Tangle app in the ticket sidebar along with the email history with the ticket requester.  View, resend, or forward an email directly from the app while working on a ticket.
  • vennie (Support)
    • vennie is the ideal solution for German eCommerce businesses aiming to streamline customer support through automation. Launched in 2024, Vennie uses AI-driven decisions and industry best practices to manage ticket responses and the entire support process. With exceptional German language support, GDPR compliance, and powerful features like updating customer or order data directly through the shop's CMS, vennie pushes the boundaries of automation. 
  • Tixo 128 (Theme)
    • Tixo 128 transforms your customer support with a stylish Zendesk theme that combines eye-catching design with powerful features. Enjoy customizable blocks and actionable prompts that make branding effortless, allowing you to set up a stunning help center without coding skills while enhancing the customer experience.
  • Merge Ticket by New Aim (Support)
    • Merge Ticket by New Aim enhances workflow efficiency by automatically merging related tickets based on predefined rules. This app automatically merges tickets from the same brand and requester with the same subject, reducing the workload and minimizing human errors. Depending on the customer, an ongoing email conversation might come through as a new ticket. This app takes care of that for you, reducing your headache and keeping your support process smooth and efficient.
  • ClickSend SMS (Support)
    • ClickSend SMS allows you to send and receive text messages seamlessly within Zendesk, enhancing your customer support capabilities globally.  Create customizable SMS templates to streamline workflows, send texts to thousands of customers, schedule messages to send on specific times and dates, and more.
  • Relay.app (Support)
    • Relay.app helps you integrate Zendesk with your other apps, from Jira, Google Workspace, Notion, and more. Coordinate across apps and automatically keep data up-to-date where you need it and when you need it. Build your first Relay.app workflow in minutes.
  • Google Admin Pro by SaaS Aid (Support) (paid)
    • Google Admin Pro by Saas Aid helps you solve your everyday IT support requests quickly and efficiently by managing Google Workspace user accounts directly from the Zendesk ticket interface.  Reset account passwords, reset two-step verification, log out users from web sessions, wipe all Oauth tokens, suspend and unsuspend accounts, and more/

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Explore
  • Talk
  • Guide and machine learning
  • Chat and messaging
  • Mobile SDKs
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: How can I prevent customers from solving their tickets?
articles.title: How can I prevent customers from solving their tickets?
articles.body:
Question

From my contact form and article suggestions, customers are able to solve their own ticket. How can I prevent my end users from closing their ticket?

Answer

You can prevent your users from solving tickets, by following either of these steps:

  • Create a trigger to automatically re-open the tickets solved by your end users
  • Otherwise, remove article suggestions by unticking Web form channel enabled

articles.name: Service Incident - September 16th, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - September 16th, 2024
articles.body:

Please refresh your Zendesk instance and let us know if you are seeing any improvements. We continue to work with our CDN provider and will provide another update in 30 minutes.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Zendesk Salesforce Integration error: STRING_TOO_LONG :: Description: data value too large
articles.title: Zendesk Salesforce Integration error: STRING_TOO_LONG :: Description: data value too large
articles.body:
Question

Why is ticket sync failing with an error in the Zendesk Salesforce integration?

Ticket ID 123456 failed to sync :: STRING_TOO_LONG :: Description: data value too large 

Answer

By default, the body description of a Zendesk ticket is synced with the Salesforce case body, which is a rich content text field. However, Salesforce currently limits this field to 32,000 characters.

There is no workaround at present, but you can consider the following:

  1. Open a case with the Salesforce Support team and inquire about increasing the character limit for the standard Case "Description" long text area field.
  2. Avoid creating tickets with more than 32,000 characters in the description. You can also recreate the ticket for the end user with less than 32,000 characters if a long thread was added to a short reply.

For more information, refer to this Salesforce article: The default limit on Long Text Area fields is 32,768 characters.

articles.name: Why doesn't the Copenhagen theme get updates?
articles.title: Why doesn't the Copenhagen theme get updates?
articles.body:
Question

What is the reason the Copenhagen theme is not receiving updates?

Answer

If the Copenhagen theme isn't updating, it may be due to custom modifications made to its code. Once a theme is altered, it's considered a custom theme, which won't receive automatic updates, as changes might conflict with your custom setup.

 

For more information, see this article: Using the standard Copenhagen theme in your help center

articles.name: Announcing the ability to reassign tickets through omnichannel routing queues
articles.title: Announcing the ability to reassign tickets through omnichannel routing queues
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
September 16, 2024 September 16, 2024 September 19, 2024

Zendesk is pleased to announce an enhancement to omnichannel routing that enables reassigning tickets through custom queues.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Until now, only new tickets that had never been assigned to an agent were eligible to be routed through custom queues for omnichannel routing. All ticket reassignments by omnichannel routing went through the standard queue.

Now, admins on Professional plans and above have the option to configure omnichannel routing to reassign tickets through custom queues. Specifically, when you turn on reassignment through queues, tickets that are reassigned back to a group go through custom queues to be assigned to an agent. Otherwise only the standard queue is used to reassign tickets.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Zendesk received a lot of feedback that users wanted to be able to use custom queues to re-route work, not just route new work. Because work from custom queues is always prioritized over work in the standard queue, reassigned tickets often had to wait longer than desirable to be reassigned to an agent and could lead to negative customer experiences and SLA breaches. This new setting gives admins the control to decide which workflow works best for their reassigned tickets.

What do I need to do?

The new setting is being rolled out to all accounts with omnichannel routing. If you have a Professional plan or above, you can edit your routing configuration to turn on reassignment through queues. See Managing your routing configuration.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - October 14, 15 & 16, 2024 | Pods 13, 17, 18, 19, 20, 23, 25, 27, 28, 29 | Support (Agent Workspace Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - October 14, 15 & 16, 2024 | Pods 13, 17, 18, 19, 20, 23, 25, 27, 28, 29 | Support (Agent Workspace Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for Agent Workspace Messaging customers on Pods 13, 17, 18, 19, 20, 23, 25, 27, 28, 29 during the times listed below.

Affected products: Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging)

Important: Agent Workspace improved messaging backend customers will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below.
Customers Affected: Zendesk customers on the Agent Workspace improved messaging backend will experience a brief service disruption of up to 20 minutes at some time within the  maintenance window.

Date (UTC) POD Start Time End Time
Mon - Oct 14, 2024 17, 18, 28, 29 00:00 UTC  /
17:00 PDT (Sun Oct 13) 		03:00 UTC /
20:00 PDT (Sun Oct 13)
Mon - Oct 14, 2024 13, 19 06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Sun Oct 13) 		08:00 UTC /
01:00 PDT
Tue - Oct 15, 2024 23, 27 06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Mon Oct 14) 		08:00 UTC /
01:00 PDT
Tue - Oct 15, 2024 25 18:00 UTC /
11:00 PDT  		20:00 UTC /
13:00 PDT 
Wed - Oct 16, 2024 20 06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Tue Oct 15) 		8:00 UTC /
01:00 PDT

Expected behavior:

During the maintenance window, customers may experience intermittent errors or degraded Messaging performance on all Messaging Channels for up to 20 minutes during the window, and agents may experience messaging delays or delayed ticket creation.

There is no data loss expected, and the service will resume seamlessly once the maintenance completes.

Outside of the specific windows outlined in the table above, customers should not experience any service impact.

What do customers have to do?

Customers are not required to take any action. Customers are recommended NOT to set ticket status to "CLOSED" for ongoing Messaging tickets that are open during the maintenance window so that any delayed messages can still be appended to the ticket after database maintenance is completed. If an ongoing messaging ticket is closed during the degraded performance window, messages not yet appended to the transcript could create another new ticket.

Why we're doing this: 

The Zendesk Messaging team is performing this maintenance work to improve the stability and scalability (storage capacity and general performance improvements) of datastores in the new Messaging Backend. This allows us to improve reliability and performance for existing and future customers to the new Messaging Backend.

articles.name: Announcement: Deprecation of Sunshine Conversations’ Help Scout Integration
articles.title: Announcement: Deprecation of Sunshine Conversations’ Help Scout Integration
articles.body:
We would like to inform our users that, as of January 6th, 2025, the Help Scout Integration with Sunshine Conversations will be officially deprecated. This decision was take due to a lack of a adoption and should therefore only impact a select few clients.

Here’s what you need to know:

  • End of Support: After January 6th, 2025, the Help Scout Integration will no longer be available or supported.
  • Alternative Options: The features support by the Help Scout integration are all available in Zendesk. Alternatively, we still have a number of other integration you may wish to explore in our Marketplace.

If you need assistance or guidance on alternative tools, our support team is here to help with any questions or concerns.

articles.name: Announcement: Deprecation of Sunshine Conversations’ Stripe Connect Integration
articles.title: Announcement: Deprecation of Sunshine Conversations’ Stripe Connect Integration
articles.body:
We want to inform our customers that, as of September 12th, 2024, the Stripe Connect Integration with Sunshine Conversations will be officially deprecated. The decision to discontinue support for this feature was based on very low usage of the feature and all impacted customers have already been notified.

What does this mean for you?

  • End of Support: AfterSeptember 12th, 2024, the Stripe Connect Integration will no longer be supported or available.

Our support team is available to assist with any questions or concerns you may have. Please don’t hesitate to reach out for guidance on alternative solutions.

Thank you for your continued trust in Sunshine Conversations. We’re excited to bring you new features and improvements in the coming months!

articles.name: Why are CC recipients not added when forwarding an email?
articles.title: Why are CC recipients not added when forwarding an email?
articles.body:
Question

Why aren't CC recipients included in the ticket when forwarding an email?

Answer

Whether or not CC recipients are included when you forward an email to create a ticket depends on your Zendesk Support settings.

  • If you allow only registered users to submit tickets, CC recipients must be existing users in the system to be included.
  • To ensure CC recipients are always added to the ticket, configure Support to permit anyone to submit tickets.

For more details, see this article: Enabling anyone to submit tickets

articles.name: Announcing wider availability of the early access program for agent copilot
articles.title: Announcing wider availability of the early access program for agent copilot
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
September 11, 2024 September 11, 2024 October 8, 2024

We’re excited to announce wider availability of an early access program (EAP) for agent copilot that is available for our customers with the Advanced AI add-on.

This announcement answers the following questions:

  • What’s changing and why?
  • How will this affect me?
  • What do I need to do?

What’s changing and why?

Agent copilot proactively suggests replies and actions to agents based on simple text procedures created for copilot by admins. Agents can accept or edit these suggestions. When a reply is accepted, it will be sent to the end user in the name of the agent. If an action is accepted, agent copilot will execute it so that the agent doesn’t have to.

This way, agents save time on coming up with next steps or actions and instead just supervise the copilot, freeing up their time to focus on more meaningful and complex tasks. Agent copilot works in any industry and doesn’t require intent predictions.

We are opening the agent copilot EAP to all Zendesk customers with the Advanced AI add-on whose Zendesk instance has been migrated to the omnichannel messaging backend.

To sign up, submit the EAP form and select agent copilot from the list of available options.

How will this affect me?

If you signed up for the agent copilot EAP and your account meets the requirements mentioned above, you will get access to agent copilot within 5 business days of signing up.

What do I need to do?

After you sign up for the EAP, there is nothing more to do. If your account meets the requirements it will be enabled within 5 business days of signing up. For more information on using agent copilot, see Using agent copilot to help agents solve tickets (EAP).

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Using round robin routing for email, messaging conversations, and call tickets
articles.title: Using round robin routing for email, messaging conversations, and call tickets
articles.body:
What's my plan?

Quick Look: Admin Center > Objects and rules > Omnichannel routing > Routing configuration
This article assumes omnichannel routing has been turned on for your account. See Turning on omnichannel routing.

Omnichannel routing is a highly configurable routing solution that can route tickets from email (including web form, side conversations, and API), calls, and messaging conversations. Agents are considered available to receive work through omnichannel routing when they have an eligible status and spare capacity for the channel.

When configuring omnichannel routing, you can choose whether to assign work based on the highest spare capacity or based on the time elapsed since agents last received work for that channel, which is commonly referred to as round robin.

This article contains the following topics:
  • Understanding how round robin routing changes the standard omnichannel routing behavior
  • Turning on round robin routing

Understanding how round robin routing changes the standard omnichannel routing behavior

The assignment methods for omnichannel routing are straightforward on the surface: either you're routing based on spare capacity or time since last assignment for the channel. However, the way these methods interact with other routing configuration options can help you make an informed decision when setting up your own omnichannel routing workflows.

When using round robin assignment, omnichannel routing bases the round robin assignment on the last time each available agent was assigned work for the channel (email, messaging, or calls). Therefore, it's important to understand that omnichannel routing considers the following events as assignments:
  • Any ticket assignment to an agent, whether manual or by omnichannel routing
  • A call or messaging ticket is offered to an agent
  • A ticket assigned to an agent is reopened
The following examples demonstrate how each assignment method would cause omnichannel routing to offer a messaging conversation ticket in different scenarios:
  • Scenario 1: Agents available
  • Scenario 2: No agents have spare capacity
  • Scenario 3: Routing with focus mode turned on

Scenario 1: Agents available

In this scenario, there are three agents in the group, all of whom have a status of Online.
  • Agent 1: Has a spare capacity of 1. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 5 minutes ago.
  • Agent 2: Has a spare capacity of 2. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 3 minutes ago.
  • Agent 3: Has a spare capacity of 3. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 1 minute ago.

Round robin

If you're using the round robin method, omnichannel routing assigns the messaging ticket to agent 1 because they've had the longest time elapsed since being assigned a ticket for the channel. This behavior is consistent across all channels.

Highest spare capacity

If you're using the standard method of highest spare capacity, omnichannel routing assigns the messaging ticket to agent 3 because they have the most spare capacity for the channel. This behavior is consistent across all channels.

Scenario 2: No agents have spare capacity

In this scenario, there are three agents in the group, all of whom have a status of Online and they are all at their maximum capacity for the messaging channel.
  • Agent 1: Has no spare capacity. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 5 minutes ago.
  • Agent 2: Has no spare capacity. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 3 minutes ago.
  • Agent 3: Has no spare capacity. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 1 minute ago.

In this scenario, omnichannel routing would behave the same way for both routing methods. The ticket would be assigned to the first agent that drops below their maximum capacity. This is true for all channels.

Scenario 3: Routing with focus mode turned on

In this scenario, there are three agents in the group, all of whom have a status of Online. Additionally, focus mode has been turned on.
  • Agent 1: Has a spare capacity of 4. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 5 minutes ago. Is on an active call.
  • Agent 2: Has a spare capacity of 2. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 3 minutes ago. Isn't on an active call.
  • Agent 3: Has a spare capacity of 4. Was assigned a messaging conversation ticket 1 minute ago. Isn't on an active call.

Round robin

If you're using the round robin method with focus mode, omnichannel routing assigns the messaging ticket to agent 2 because they've had the longest time elapsed since being assigned a ticket for the channel while also not having an active call. This is because focus mode prevents omnichannel routing from assigning messaging tickets to an agent while they're working on a call and vice versa. Email tickets are excluded from focus mode, and therefore would be routed to agent 1 in this scenario.

Additionally, if focus mode wasn't enabled but all other factors remained the same, omnichannel routing would assign the ticket to agent 1 because they've had the longest time elapsed since being assigned a ticket for the channel.

Highest spare capacity

If you're using the standard method of highest spare capacity with focus mode, omnichannel routing assigns the messaging ticket to agent 3 because they have the most spare capacity for the channel while also not having an active call. This is because focus mode prevents omnichannel routing from assigning messaging tickets to an agent while they're working on a call and vice versa.

Email tickets are excluded from focus mode, and therefore would be routed to agent 1 in this scenario because agent 1 and agent 3 have the same spare capacity, but agent 1 has gone longer without being assigned work for the channel. This would also be the behavior if focus mode was off but all other factors remained the same.

Turning on round robin routing

Round robin routing can be turned on in your omnichannel routing configuration.

To turn on round robin routing
  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Omnichannel routing > Routing configuration.
  2. On the Routing Configuration page, click Edit next to the Initial routing configuration.
  3. Under Assignment method, select Round robin.
  4. Click Save.

articles.name: Release notes through 2024-09-06
articles.title: Release notes through 2024-09-06
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released in the last month.

This week's release notes include:

    • Support
    • Explore
    • App Marketplace
    • Products with no updates this week

Support

New

  • Configurable custom object cards as record previews in Agent Workspace. Read more.

Explore

New

  • We've released the following new activity metrics and attributes for Explore:
    • Ticket requester updated metric to the Updates history and SLA datasets.
    • Agent replies, assignee stations, group stations, and reopens attributes to the Knowledge capture dataset.

App Marketplace

New
  • Advanced Security by Adelante (Support) 
    • Advanced Security by Adelante helps secure your Zendesk from admin mistakes and misconfigurations.  Advanced Security by Adelante gives you real-time updates on new integrations, permission issues, and changes in security settings. You will be notified when one of your Zendesk admins takes an action that affects your company’s security. You can revoke the change, ask for a business case, or get more information.  If you’ve revoked the change, your Zendesk instance will return to how it was before. The installing user will be notified if you’ve asked for a business justification. You will receive all the information gathered if you’ve asked for more information. This way, you can make sure no risk goes unnoticed.
  • Advanced Search Plus (Support)
    • Advanced Search Plus lets you search for tickets, users, and organizations with advanced filters and sorting.  Narrow your search with complex "is" and "is not" filters.  Filter by any system or custom field.  Navigate your search results with ease and export them easily to CSV.

Products with no updates this week

  • AI agents (formerly bots)
  • Talk
  • Guide and machine learning
  • Chat and messaging
  • Mobile SDKs
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Why hours until due date doesn't work after due date expires?
articles.title: Why hours until due date doesn't work after due date expires?
articles.body:
Question

Why doesn't hours until due date work after the due date?

Answer

The hours until the due date condition is not recognized after the due date has passed because it only tracks the time left until the due date. Once the due date is missed, the ticket is marked as overdue.

In these situations, use the hours since due date condition to manage and take action on tickets that are past their due date. This helps to properly flag and address overdue tickets with a different logic system.

 

For more information, see this article: About automations and how they work

articles.name: What happens to tickets when an agent is out of office?
articles.title: What happens to tickets when an agent is out of office?
articles.body:
Question

With the Out of Office app, tickets remain assigned to my agents. What happens to Zendesk tickets when an agent is out of office?

Answer

When you notice unexpected errors with the app, follow these steps:

  • Try uninstalling and reinstalling the app
  • Follow the How to install tab and re-configure the app for your agents

For more information, see this article: Installing and using the Out of Office app.

articles.name: Can federated search results appear in the Zendesk Guide dashboard?
articles.title: Can federated search results appear in the Zendesk Guide dashboard?
articles.body:
Question

In my tickets, I added federated search results with the Knowledge side panel.

Can those results appear in Explore, within the Knowledge Capture tab of the Zendesk Guide dashboard?

Answer

No, federated search results are not supported by the Zendesk Guide dashboard.

articles.name: Webhooks are not available for Zendesk Sell
articles.title: Webhooks are not available for Zendesk Sell
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

I'd like to create a webhook to notify users when a deal, contact, and company data in Sell is updated. However, I cannot create webhooks for Sell.

Resolution steps

Webhooks are not available in Zendesk Sell. Instead, use the API or a third party application, such as Zapier.

Note: Zendesk Support can't provide support for third-party apps or custom code. Reach out to your developers or the support email address of the third-party app under "App details" in the App Marketplace or try searching for a solution online.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance - September 26 ~ October 21, 2024 | All Pods | Chat and Messaging through Agent Workspace (Support) - Database upgrade
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance - September 26 ~ October 21, 2024 | All Pods | Chat and Messaging through Agent Workspace (Support) - Database upgrade
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform scheduled database maintenance between September 26 to October 21, 2024, as part of a crucial version upgrade to the "AWS Aurora" software. This upgrade will enhance the underlying databases of our services that support essential Chat and Messaging functionalities, impacting database clusters across all Zendesk Pods associated with Chat and Messaging through the Agent Workspace (Support) during the specified dates, with various Pods affected at the designated times outlined below.

Affected products: Chat and Messaging through Agent Workspace (Support)

Important: Customers using Messaging, Web/Mobile Messaging and SunCo SDK with Agent Workspace will have a degraded experience such as delayed message delivery.
Customers Affected: Customers using Zendesk Chat and Messaging through Agent Workspace (Support) on the Pods listed below will experience a cumulative maximum service disruption of 10 minutes during their respective Pod maintenance window.
Date POD Start Time End Time
Thu - September 26 26 01:00 UTC /
18:00 PST (Sep 25)		 02:00 UTC /
19:00 PST (Sep 25)
Wed - October 2 18, 29 01:00 UTC /
18:00 PST (Oct 1)		 02:00 UTC /
19:00 PST (Oct 1)
Mon - October 7 17, 28, 31 01:00 UTC /
18:00 PST (Oct 6)		 02:00 UTC /
19:00 PST (Oct 6)
Wed - October 9 13, 19, 23 08:00 UTC /
01:00 PST		 09:00 UTC /
02:00 PST
Fri - October 11 30 01:00 UTC /
18:00 PST (Oct 10)		 02:00 UTC /
19:00 PST (Oct 10)
Sat - October 12
 25

22:00 UTC /
15:00 PST

23:00 UTC /
16:00 PST
Mon - October 14 20, 27 08:00 UTC /
01:00 PST
 09:00 UTC /
02:00 PST
Mon - October 14 15 10:00 UTC /
03:00 PST
 11:00 UTC /
04:00 PST
Mon - October 21 (Note) All Pods 01:00 UTC /
18:00 PST (Oct 20)		 02:00 UTC /
19:00 PST (Oct 20)

Expected behavior:

Customers using Zendesk Chat and Messaging through Agent Workspace (Support) on the Pods listed above will experience intermittent errors or performance degradation within the corresponding maintenance window. This includes: 

  • Customers using Messaging, Web/Mobile Messaging and SunCo SDK with Agent Workspace will have a degraded experience such as delayed message delivery.
  • Ongoing live chat conversations will not be disrupted.
  • Chat dashboard will be accessible but most of the admin functionality will be unavailable.
  • Completed chats will take longer to appear on the dashboard.
  • Agents will not be able to respond to the messaging tickets during the maintenance window.

What do customers have to do?

Customers are not required to take any action. However, it is recommended that they establish a maintenance information banner for their end-users, indicating potential delays and other anticipated behaviors that may occur when responding to inquiries during the designated maintenance window date and time.

Why we're doing this: 

From time to time, Zendesk needs to perform upgrades to underlying database technologies used to power its services. These upgrades are necessary to ensure performance, security and reliability.

Note: The conclusion date for this maintenance is established for October 21 to provide an opportunity for any required modifications or adjustments following the final scheduled window on October 14; however, such adjustments may not be necessary. This date serves as a precautionary placeholder.

articles.name: Service Incident - September 4, 2024 - Admin Center | All Pods - Access issues with the Billing admin page
articles.title: Service Incident - September 4, 2024 - Admin Center | All Pods - Access issues with the Billing admin page
articles.body:
SUMMARY

On September 4, 2024 from 18:21 UTC to 23:22 UTC, customers experienced difficulties in purchasing, previewing items, and performing other operations in the shopping cart due to an upstream issue with our billing partner.

Timeline

September 04, 2024 07:17 PM UTC | September 04, 2024 12:17 PM PT
We are investigating access issues with the Billing admin page. We will provide an update in 30 minutes or when we have more information to share.

September 04, 2024 07:23 PM UTC | September 04, 2024 12:23 PM PT
Our billing partner is currently experiencing a service degradation and our engineers have placed Billing in maintenance mode until the degradation is resolved. Subscription changes will be disabled until the service incident is resolved. We will provide another update in one hour or when we have new information to share.

September 04, 2024 09:33 PM UTC | September 04, 2024 02:33 PM PT
Our billing partner continues to experience a service degradation and Admin Center Billing remains in maintenance mode until the degradation is resolved. Subscription changes will remain disabled until the service incident is resolved. We will provide another when our partner's service incident has been resolved.

September 05, 2024 12:11 AM UTC | September 04, 2024 05:11 PM PT
Our engineers have taken Billing out of maintenance mode and restored Billing access now that our partner's service incident has been resolved. You can now update your account subscriptions again. Please clear your browser cache and cookies for the changes to take effect.

 

POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by an outage in Zuora's production environment, linked to an issue with their Redis caching layer. Zuora's outage prevented our billing system from functioning correctly, which in turn impacted various customer-facing functionalities dependent on Zuora.

Resolution

To address the issue, the billing team placed the billing app into maintenance mode and reached out to Zuora for a resolution. Zuora identified and fixed their issue, allowing the billing app to resume normal operations.

Remediation Items

  1. Improve robustness of the billing breakers page to handle performance issues triggered by Zuora outages.
  2. Ensure essential functions can still load and function partially even if Zuora is down.
  3. Implement proactive alerts and circuit breakers to automatically enter maintenance mode if a Zuora outage is detected.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Service Incident - September 4, 2024 - Talk | All Pods - Extra "1" appended to numbers
articles.title: Service Incident - September 4, 2024 - Talk | All Pods - Extra "1" appended to numbers
articles.body:
SUMMARY

From August 30, 2024 12:16 PM UTC to September 2, 2024 09:15 AM UTC, customers using Zendesk Talk for SMS and calls encountered an issue where, newly created SMS end users had an invalid phone number displayed, as an additional "1" was erroneously appended to the end of their numbers. Consequently, agents were unable to send messages or initiate calls to these end users.

Timeline

September 04, 2024 01:05 PM UTC | September 04, 2024 06:05 AM PT
Between 12:16 PM UTC on August 30th and 09:15 AM UTC on September 2nd, customers using Talk and Support reported an extra “1” being added to end-user phone numbers. This issue impacted their ability to make calls and required manual corrections. Any customer who received SMS messages in the last five days would have been affected. On Monday, we identified the root cause and rectified the issue. Unfortunately, the previously deployed fix was accidentally rolled back yesterday. However, our engineers have re-deployed the fix, and the issue is now fully resolved. The fix ensures that any new user identities created during the active period of the fix do not have the rogue “1" appended. Additionally, the temporary rollback has been corrected, ensuring that no new user identities are created with the erroneous “1”.


POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

This incident occurred due to an unintended consequence of a cleanup pull request (PR) that reactivated an old rollout process from 2018. This process automatically updated new SMS end users' phone numbers, adding an "sms_capability" attribute with a value of "1". The extension model fetched this information, resulting in an erroneous “1” being appended to the phone numbers of new SMS end users. 

Resolution

To resolve this issue, the problematic code responsible for adding the "1" to new SMS end users' phone numbers was identified and disabled. Ensuring that the sms_capability attribute is no longer incorrectly applied to phone numbers.

Remediation Items

  1. Fix the User Phone Extension model to pick the appropriate records to add phone number extension to end user numbers. [Done]
  2. Eliminate unused phone identity update code from the SMS system, as it was discovered to be outdated and malfunctioning. [To do]
  3. Clean up any existing user_phone_attributes that were incorrectly created with the sms_capability attribute. [To do]
  4. Implement an automated test to ensure that sending a message to a Zendesk Text number results in a correctly formatted ticket and new end user creation. This test should simulate calling the end user to ensure their phone number is valid and not appended with an erroneous digit. [To do]
  5. Develop a more sophisticated alerting system that can differentiate between truly invalid numbers and false positives to minimize unnecessary alerts while still catching legitimate issues. [To do]


FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: How can I receive an invoice for a custom theme?
articles.title: How can I receive an invoice for a custom theme?
articles.body:
Question

I purchased a custom theme. How can I get an invoice?

Answer

Custom themes might not be designed by Zendesk. To request an invoice, reach out to the theme creator and manager directly.

To find an invoice for a custom theme

  1. Search the Marketplace for your theme and select the theme name.
  2. The contact details for the theme are displayed under Contact Us.

For more information, see this article: Adding a help center theme to Guide.

articles.name: How can I export all tabs from a dashboard?
articles.title: How can I export all tabs from a dashboard?
articles.body:
Question

In Explore, I'd like to export all the tabs from my dashboard. How can I proceed?

Answer

In dashboards, you can only export tabs one by one. As a workaround, export each tab separately. Then, use an external tool to merge your documents. For example, if you exported several PDF files, use an external tool to merge those files.

For more information, see this article: Exporting dashboard tabs and reports.

articles.name: Release notes through 2024-08-30
articles.title: Release notes through 2024-08-30
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released in the last month.

This week's release notes include:

    • Talk
    • AI agents (formerly bots)
    • App Marketplace
    • Products with no updates this week

Talk

Fixed

  • Fixed a bug that caused lines to appear twice on the Lines page.
  • We resolved an issue where some transcripts and summaries were not being added to tickets.
  • Addressed a bug that led to calls dropping when line settings were changed.
  • Fixed a problem where persons in transcripts and summaries were mixed up, resulting in inaccurate information.

AI agents (formerly bots)

Fixed

  • In Explore's Answer Bot pre-built Flow Builder overview dashboard, the % engaged with bot and % transferred to agent metrics have been updated to respect the time filter. Previously, they would only calculate based on all time.

App Marketplace

New
  • Okta Admin Pro by SaaS Aid (Support) (paid)
    • Okta Admin Pro by SaaS Aid helps you solve your IT support Okta account requests from within Zendesk.  Easy perform actions like resetting passwords, unlocking accounts, resetting MFA enrollments, clearing user sessions, suspending accounts, viewing/adding/removing users to Okta groups, and more

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Guide and machine learning
  • Chat and messaging
  • Mobile SDKs
  • Explore
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: My agents don't see the Customers page
articles.title: My agents don't see the Customers page
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

Agents cannot create end users and do not have access to the Customers page.

Resolution steps

To allow agents to view and add end users on the Customers page, they must have permission to access all tickets. Depending on your plan, you can give access by following these steps:

  • On the Professional plan or below, the agent profile controls the access and, in particular, the Access field > All tickets value
  • On the Enterprise plan or above, agent permissions are determined by custom roles > End-user profile access

articles.name: How can I create bot responses to words such as hello and thanks?
articles.title: How can I create bot responses to words such as hello and thanks?
articles.body:
Question

In messaging, I noticed my bot doesn't respond when customers write hello or thank you. How can I create responses?

Answer

  1. You can create an answer flow for each option
  2. For When to show this answer, add the keywords of your choice > Next
  3. Create the flow of your choice
  4. Click Done > Publish bot

articles.name: Error: Translation wasn't updated. Try again
articles.title: Error: Translation wasn't updated. Try again
articles.body:
Question

I am experiencing an issue where I am unable to edit articles in the Guide, and I repeatedly receive the error message: Translation wasn't updated. Try again. What could be causing this problem?

Answer

The error message Translation wasn't updated. Try again is likely due to the presence of a content block within the article you are attempting to edit.

Your current subscription plan may not support content blocks. Only Suite and Guide Enterprise plans include this feature.

To resolve this issue, review the article for any inadvertently added content blocks. If you identify any, remove them from the article. This should enable you to edit the article without encountering the error message again.
